info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 9:25PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Albany County through 1000 PM EDT... At 925 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Westerlo, or 16 miles southwest of Delmar, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Westerlo, Rensselaerville, Clarksville, Coeymans Hollow, Snyders Corners, Shoefelt Corners, South Westerlo, Dormansville, Alcove, Keefers Corners, Smith Corner, Reidsville, Medusa, Bramans Corners and Lambs Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
